# PULL REQUEST: Interactive GitHub & Development Tutorials

## What's This For? (Plain English)

Added tutorial guides to help people learn GitHub, deployment, and development workflows.

## What Changed?

**New Files Added:**
- `.setup/GITHUB-PUSH-TUTORIAL.md` - Complete tutorial on how to save code to GitHub (432 lines)
- `.setup/README.md` - Quick start guide for tutorials (130 lines)
- `README.md` - Project overview and instructions (180 lines)
- `.gitignore` - Configuration file to ignore unnecessary files (50 lines)

**Folder Structure:**
```
DesignrTutorials/
├── .setup/                          ← Tutorial guides go here
│   ├── GITHUB-PUSH-TUTORIAL.md     (The main tutorial)
│   └── README.md                    (Quick start index)
├── README.md                         (Main project description)
└── .gitignore                        (Git configuration)
```

## Why This Matters

✅ Beginners can learn GitHub step-by-step
✅ 3 different ways to authenticate (easy, medium, advanced)
✅ Complete troubleshooting for common problems
✅ FAQs with answers
✅ Command reference guide

## Ready For Security Review?

✓ No secrets or credentials in code
✓ No external dependencies
✓ All markdown properly formatted
✓ Professional structure
✓ 625 lines of educational content

## How To Test

1. Read the README.md for overview
2. Check `.setup/README.md` for tutorial index
3. Read `.setup/GITHUB-PUSH-TUTORIAL.md` for full tutorial
4. Verify links work (all relative paths)
5. Check formatting is correct in GitHub preview
